estion "What is the minimum value of $x$ such that the difference in area between the two new squares is at least as great as the area of a $2009$ by $2009$ square?", we need to carry out the following steps:
Determine the original area of square A and square B.
Calculate the new area of square A after increasing both its length and width by $x$.
Calculate the new area of square B after decreasing both its length and width by $x$.
Formulate an expression for the difference in area between the new square A and the new square B.
Set up an inequality where this difference in area is at least as great as the area of the original $2009$ by $2009$ square.
Solve the inequality for $x$ to find the minimum value needed.
